summary:
I passionately pursue a just, democratic world, free from armed conflict; a nature-positive world for many generations to come.  

As an enthusiastic connector I build internal and external bridges. I provide creative solutions based on sound analysis to achieve greater impact, effectiveness, and efficiency.  I provide strategic direction, alliance-building, programme quality, M&E and institutional learning, risk management, effective change processes, and enhancement of (financial) viability, to ensure organisations define and attain their objectives and to help bring these institutions to the next level.  

Solutions-oriented organisational leader with 20 years of rights-based experience covering 30 countries in Africa, the Middle East, (eastern) Europe and South America. My leadership skills were honed as Director of programmes, and interim Deputy Executive Director of international NGOs, one with +400 staff.  

This experience has furthermore equipped me with extensive skills in mediation, diplomacy, high-level dialogue, crisis response, capacity building, and essential operational expertise as acquisition and grant-/contract management of complex grants. USD 23 million budget responsibility p.a. 

Some characteristics: Self-driven. Upholds integrity. Optimistic. Persevering even when faced with adversity.  

Interested in senior management roles with NGOs; (Local) Government; philanthropic institutions in The Netherlands.

profile_positions.description:
Member of senior management team (SMT) of this non-profit organisation specialised in mediation in armed conflict. 
•	Set up Programmes department heading preventive diplomacy, facilitated dialogue and mediation globally. Responsible for programme development in 12+ countries. EIP established a niche in an initially hostile climate. 
•	Established PCVE Unit and launched interventions in Europe, Middle East, Horn of Africa, and coastal West Africa. 
Initiated positioning and brand recognition by Governments, UN and EU bodies involved in conflict prevention & resolution. Consistently building on communication, trust, alliances, high-quality implementation and legitimacy. 
•	Established programme management systems and tools within a year. Contributed to EIP policies for HR; Finance & Grant management; Gender & Inclusion. 
•	Brought in the first EU funds and multimillion grants. Arranged relationship-management and built internal capacity for grant- and partnership-management.
•	Examples of impact: Ceasefire agreement in southern Libya’s Kufra; Emergence of 2 autonomous peace movements in Yemen (women; academics); Preventive diplomacy on radicalisation in coastal West Africa culminated in the Extraordinary Joint ECOWAS-ECAS Summit of Heads of State on Peace, Security, Stability and the Fight Against Terrorism and Violent Extremism on 8th July 2018 which EIP helped design

•	Serving in two consecutive director roles, I led these processes, including the systemic, policy and structural changes which accompany it. First for the Burundi country programme, then for Oxfam’s Pan-Africa advocacy.

•	Directly supported the empowered of African civil society through institutional capacity building and influencing advice. Oversaw design influencing strategies for Oxfam affiliates and NGO allies. This included campaigns, lobby and advocacy on AU and AU Member States' commitments on peace & security; human rights; justice; trade & development.
•	Guided innovation and identification of Best Practices. Part of Oxfam confederation’s Community of Practice to refine tools for Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning (MEAL). 
•	Led resource mobilisation for Oxfam and in coalitions.

profile_positions.description:
UK-registered NGO for Social Justice and Development in Africa. As SMT member I codefined ACORD’s direction, saw to governance, institutional development, and risk management leadership. Achievements include:
•	Assured direction, oversight, methodological guidance for its development & humanitarian interventions:
       -	Line management and leadership support to ACORD’s 14 Area Programme Managers (i.e. regional and country directors covering 18 countries and +400 staff in Africa). 
       -	Ensured adequate organisational structures to effectively achieve goals. Led restructuring in Mozambique, Angola, Ethiopia, and elsewhere, while empathetically managing staff motivation and concerns.
       -	Strengthened institutional capacity for programming, monitoring, evaluation, and learning.
•	Developed systems for improved financial viability and stability, rolled out with Funding and Finance. This resulted in improved financial viability of the organisation at the time I left.
•	Coordinated conceptualisation of institutional strategic plan 2011-15. Developed its organisational learning approach.
 
ACORD delivers rights-based programs on sustainable development (such as climate-conscious livelihoods and inclusive governance), conflict transformation, women's rights & gender, and HIV/AIDS; it has a Pan-African advocacy program on food security. These are pursued through research; reinforcing community coping mechanisms, civil society and government capacities; as well as policy-influencing through campaigns and advocacy.

profile_positions.description:
Guest Lecturer on humanitarian assistance and development programmes at the Master's Degree Course “Network on Humanitarian Assistance” (NOHA). 

The NOHA programme was initiated by the European Commisions Directorat General Humanitarian Aid (ECHO) in 1994, together with the Directorate-General Education and Culture of the EC (http://www.rug.nl/let/onderwijs/master/humanitarianassistance/index). Students included existing and prospective practitioners in the fields of humanitarian relief and international co-operation, fundraisers, researchers, evaluators, project monitors, lobbyists, consultants, etc.
